intro: Lachenalia lutea, commonly known as the yellow lachenalia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, cylindrical stems and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its flowering period occurs in late summer to early autumn, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Lachenalia lutea is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to care for in suitable conditions.
